text: You can feel the beautiful marzipan smell right after opening the bottle, you dont even have to get your nose close to it. The aroma gets more intense after its poured to the glass. Its very sweet - barrel notes, vanilla, marzipan, chocolate. The taste is as great - chocolate liqueur, again vanilla and marzipan, some wood. The finish is coffee, nice biterness and some alcohol pleasantly warming as it goes down the throat. The mouthfeel is fantastic, the body is full, carbonation is low and the beer is very velvety on the palate. Wow, this imperial stout is a huge bourbon-barrel bomb.

Lots of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and coffee in nose. Pours pitch black with tan head. Taste is sweet with huge vanilla, some coconut, chocolate, coffee, some alcohol. Medium bitter finish, full body, soft carbonation. Overall very good dessert stout.

Pours pitch black, small bubbly foam. Vanilla. With warming, more intense. Cocoa, chocolate, some fruits, coconut, bourbon. Perfect balance between roasty bitterness snd sweetness. Full body, oily, good, soft carbonation.
Co tu się dzieje - wanilia, kokos, migdały, mleczna czekolada, gęste, słodkie, po prostu rozwala na łopatki.

Piękny aromat, głównie kojarzący się z lodami czekoladowo-waniliowymi. W smaku dużo kokosa, kakao i wanilii. Słodkie, zero alkoholu. Na początku gdy było chłodniejsze były to lody, później wraz z ogrzaniem piwo zrobiło się ciasteczkiem. Zdecydowanie jest to piwo idące w jedną stronę #teamsłodyczka, ale jest w tym absolutnie świetne i daje mnóstwo przyjemnych doznań.

Piwo czarne, oleiste. Z mozołem budująca się piana. W aromacie oczywiście vanilia, budyń, mascarpone, krem brulee, proszek do pieczenia. 
Gęste i treściwe. Gładkie, kremowe. Czekoladowe. Wszystko gra. Na finiszu delikatna goryczka i alkohol.
Wonderful beer, appropriate imperial stout scents with perfect bourbon barrel aromas addition. Black, little foam. Full bodied, tasty, subtle alcohol in mouthfeel.
Black with no head, very little light penetration. Viscous mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Vanilla in your face. clawingly sweet.
Wonderful, wonderful beer. Full bodied, creamy texture and appearance. Beautiful wood and vanilla in aroma and taste, rich coffee and cocoa. YUM.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 Wygląd: prawie nieprzejrzyscie czarne, rubinowe refleksy, piana bardzo szybko redukuje się do milimetrowej obraczki
Aromat: bogaty, intensywny zapach wanilii i kokosów, beczka po bourbonie gra pierwsze skrzypce, czuć też, kawę, mleczną czekoladę, toffi, troszeczkę pralin, aromat miód.
Smak: intensywnie kokosowo-wanililiowy, nuty drewniane, lekkie wiśnie w czekoladzie, finiszuje trochę kawą, fajnie oleiste, takie miodowo  likierowe. Ogólnie bardzo pijalne i jak najbardziej zasługuje na Top 50 RB. Mega Piwo.

From Mikkeller & Friends web bottle shop@: Pours black opaque color with tan brown head which dissipate immediately into a ring around the glass. Aroma: mild noticeable bourbon, supported by vanilla, hint of oak, dark chocolate and coffee... Flavor just follows aroma: bourbon is discrete, pretty well blended with roasted grain, dark malts, creamy sweet presence of vanilla and coffee. Therere also noticeable notes of tobacco, oak/wood, port wine-like alcohol, esters with notes of dried & dark fruits. Finish is slighty dry. Body is thick, texture is silky, smooth, carbonation is low.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle with no wax dated September 5, 2016. 
Aroma is rich with lots of dark chocolate and vanilla. Some light roast and faint coconut and almond notes. Moderate bourbon character with light oak. Medium light alcohol notes. 
Pours black with a medium small, moderately thick, light mocha head that recedes somewhat quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit. Faint lacing and moderately long legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with tons of chocolate and some lighter roast notes. Moderately strong vanilla notes. Light oak character with some faint almond and coconut notes. Medium light bourbon with some light alcohol spice. Lingering chocolate and sugar. 
Mouthfeel is medium full to full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice vanilla BA stout, but Im not sure it crosses over into the upper echelon. Lots of dessert like chocolate and vanilla notes. Bourbon is fairly light.

Dark black liquid with some reddish glints, small beige head. Nose is crazy vanilla, caramel, chocolate, coffee, small bourbon hints. As intense in nose, vanilla is all over place in taste, but in a good way, roasted malt, coffee, medium to high sweetness, very dark chocolate bitterness, we can taste some bourbon and woody notes as well. It feels like having a vanilla malty ice cream in a glass. Its creamy, almost full body, long never-ending aftertaste. A nice warmth in the throat that remember us its 13%. Very very good, well balanced brew.
Cant say I like it better than the regular edition, but the warming bourbon and vanilla trail was very very nice. Great nose and flavor. Look and feel are thin but its quite smooth drinking.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Bottle (Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen). Black with delicate, beige head. Aroma is incredible, sweet vanilla, intense but delicate, chocolate, you feel like in heaven. Chocolate, sweet vanilla and great balance, very smooth in taste. It is great, really the best I drunk till moment. Drinking this beer you feel like in paradise. Such great balance between ris and barrel I ve never met, everything work fine and each sip it is like one step to paradise, closer and closer.

deep dark brown, almost black colour, minimal creamy brown head; amazing aroma of vanilla, coffee, milk chocolate, bourbon barrel, some toffee, hints of coconut , walnut and herbal liqueur notes; taste of vanilla, coffee, syrupy, walnut and woody-bourbon notes; spicy alcoholic aftertaste; incredible imperial stout!

Piwo w kolorze czarnym nalewa sie z minimalna iloscia sredniopecherzykowej piany ktora znika bez sladu. W aromacie wanilia, slodka czekolada i palona kawa. Wszystko bardzo intensywne i zapowiada sie rownie ciekawie w smaku. Bardze geste , pelne i zaklejajace cialo, sredniwysoka goryczka i wysycenie na niskim poziomie. Sa zdecydowanie nuty bourbonu, wanili i beczki. Mix czekolady, kokosa i miodu. Slodkie z lekko palonym finiszem. Jest naprawde mega dobrze!
I love the strong aroma and the taste. The only thing that could be improved that there is not a really strong taste or smell of bourbon.

Aroma: vanilla, caramel, alcohol and fruity (plum), taste follows the aroma, thick vanilla, creamy body, long aftertaste with appropriate bitter-sweetness. Only thing is that bourbon quality could be better, it feels like brandy, and alcohol in the aftertaste, but this might be not too bad either

Bottle shared at tasting. Clear dark brown colour, tan head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, coconut, milk chocolate, fudge. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light bitter: intense vanilla, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, coconut - great balance. Full body, oily, smooth texture, soft carbonation. Magnificent dessert imp - sweet, but not over the top, with very rich aroma and taste, high drinkability, perfectly hidden alcohol.

Bottle at Jezs Bday. If I could give a beer an 11/10 for its aroma then this would have it. Fucking unreal. Its like bourbon-laden sweet honeycomb. Makes me salivate to no ends. The only slight downfall I have to this beer is I wanted the mouth feel to be a little fuller. Such a marginal dissatisfaction though. Seriously sensational beer, especially for the price

Bottle shared by oRos. Pours dark brown with a modest tan head and a complex aroma that includes chocolate, vanilla, coffee and bourbon. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with a bit of vanilla and a coffee finish. This is a great brew.

Aroma: Sweet vanilla and malt like a cookie. 
Flavour: Roasted malt with sweetness and vanilla. Aftertaste is sweet with roasted malt and bitterness. Mouthfeel is creamy. 
Colour: very dark brown with a white head.

Piwo bardzo ciemne, nieprzejrzyste, praktycznie zerowa piana. W zapachu nozdrza atakuje kokos i wanilia, następnie pralinki, mleczna czekolada, delikatne wafelki i subtelny alkohol. Aromat znacznie przyjemniejszy niż w wersji podstawowej. W smaku również kokos i wanilia, mleczna czekolada, kawa, przyjemny alkohol. Wersja BA jest mniej gęsta i wyklejająca, alkohol mniej zaznacza swoją obecność. Zdecydowanie team słodyczka. Super piwo.

330 ml bottle. The beer is black with a very small light brown head. The aroma is a nice mix of barrel, vanilla, coffee and chocolatey stout. Its not dominated by vanilla like the non-ba version. The bourbon barrel reins the flavors in without dominating itself. The flavors all kinda harmonize. Taste is sweet and still pushes hard on that vanilla pedal. Big marshmallow flavor around a fudgey chocolate center, drizzled with bourbon caramel syrup. Soft, full body. The barrely finish pulls back on that sugar without thinning the beer out. Mikkeller does wonderful work with barrels. This is a fantastic beer and deserves heaps of praise.
Z: wanilia, mleko, wanilia z beczki S: intensywna wanilia, mleko, lekka czekolada. #teamslodyczka. Rewelacja. Posmak na słodko. No nazwa adekwatna do zawartości butelki.

Un liquide visqueux a priori brun foncé qui, une fois installé dans mon verre, se transforme en une bête noire. Beau petit col qui résiste pour quelques gorgées. Un nez complètement débile de noix de coco, de caramel, de brownie, de gâteau vanillé et mouillé par un bourbon à la fois boisé et saturé de guimauves dégoulinantes avec coulis de Nutella® et sirop dérable foncé. Au goût, la parfaite combinaison de trucs quon ajoute dans une bière noire vieillie en fût et qui peut sans aucun doute impressionner lamateur que je suis qui aime les artifices dans les impériaux stouts abandonnés aux gestes précis dun groupe de brasseurs fous qui adorent les excès contrôlés ou les folles aventures dun hasard provoqué par un éclair de génie. En bouche, beau corps plutôt tranquille comme une liqueur riche quon réserve pour les grandes occasions. En finale, le bourbon enveloppe ce gros biscuit gaufré décadent qui couvre longuement chacune de mes papilles. Incroyable «imperial sweet stout». Merci à Pat pour cette fantastique chance!

Aroma: vanilla, more vanilla, marshmallows, coconut, chocolate, nuts
Taste: heavy sweet, vanilla, coconut, chocolate, nuts, vanilla, oak

Pours a viscous, motor oil black color, with no head. Very thick, leaves back alcohol legs after swirling, still producing no head at all.

Both, vanilla and the barrel are very pronounced on the nose, evoking a sweeter, warming, dessert like impression. Underneath that, there are layers of molasses, caramel, earthy coffee, all leading back to the flowery, sweet vanilla, accompanied by rich, slighty hot wood. Malts add a glazed caramel impression to the beer, illustrating the sugary, biting booze, perfectly coated up by the vanilla sweetness.

Almost no carbonation at all remains recognizable among the incredible smooth mouthfeel, highlighting the beers full body.

Tastes of earthy malts, toffee, molasses, with vanilla becoming detectable at the same time as the the warming barrel does, balanced by slightly bitter, crushed coffee beans. Overall the beer is well balanced, while I expected its taste being sweeter, leading from the aromas. Coffee, toasted malts and earthy toffee exhibit a convincing counterpart to the molasses and cane sugar in the beer, resulting in a slightly bitter, hot finish. The Bourbon is well-developed, adding a lot of depth to the vanilla, as well as a pleasant bite, enhancing the dry, earthy coffee, which turns even more present during the finish.

Overall this beer tastes very interesting to me, based on the fact that it is much more that the nose revealed. It is in no way sticky sweet, while the vanilla gets beautifully enhanced by the prominent Bourbon. Unfortunately, the beers aftertaste does not come together too well for me, as coffee, vanilla and oak blend into malty, earthy liquorice, pretty much annihilating the present, but fragile vanilla impression.

Incredibly much scent of bourbon. A bit too much. It was almost more alcohol. Even coffee, chocolate and vanilla in the aroma. The taste is really good, and the coffee, dark chocolate, oak, vanilla and whiskey. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Good beer but had higher expectations for this beer. 330 mL bottle. Pours a murky black with no head. The thinnest of collars. Smells of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, and whiskey. Hefty oak. Tastes very oaky. Coffee throughout. Vanilla kicks in behind the coffee and makes it seem sweet. Bourbon kicks in and makes it seem less sweet. Eventually they combine to a bourbon and vanilla finish. Boozy and medium heavy with low carbonation. Excellent. Way over the top with the vanilla, but the barrel keeps it interesting.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 W aromacie wanilia, kokos, marcepan lekka kawa i potężna beczka. Gęste, ciemne, nieprzejrzyste. W smaku bardzo złożone dużo wanilii, marcepanu trochę słodkie mlecznej czekolady. Oblepiające i zostawiające posmak na długo. Mimo wysokiej zawartości alkoholu jest on niewyczuwalny.

Po otwarciu butelki momentalnie buchają nuty bourbonowej beczki. Kokos, marcepan, wanilia, amaretto, poza tym kawa, kakao (co w połączeniu z likierem migdałowym nasuwa skojarzenie z tiramisu). W smaku zdominowane przez beczkę, ale spod ton bourbonu wybija się bazowy Vanilla Shake. Dużo słodsze od podstawowej wersji (jak dla mnie nawet ciut za bardzo). Piwo jest zdecydowanie wybitne, prawdopodobnie najlepsze, jakie piłem jak dotąd, chociaż uważam, że troszkę mniejszy wkład beczki nie odebrałby tu klasy, co najwyżej bardziej odkryłby więcej nut palonych, typowych dla RISa. Czapki z głów.

Bottle. Dark brown nearly black body with no head. Aroma is dark caramel vanilla dried fruits cocoa raisins and some alcohol. Taste is vanilla wood roasted malts wood vanilla dried fruits. Aftertaste is nice slightly roasted malts with wood and some alcohol balanced by some bitterness. Nice one.
W zapachu aromat wanilii i beczki po burbonie, praliny czekoladowe. W smaku przypomina mi lody waniliowe z grycana z dodatkiem czekolady.
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 Butelka. Przyjemny, intensywny aromat wanilli, beczki, mlecznej czekolady. Duzo wanilli ale tej niebevzkowej. Tak czy inaczej konkret.
Pours pitch black with a minimum head. Aroma is vanilla roasted malts boozy chocolate bourbon. Flavor velvety roasted vanilla coffee chocolate nice bitterness.

Bottle 16 - pours dark brown/black with dark tan head. Lots of vanilla and bourbon in the nose with some chocolate notes. Taste is fudge, vanilla, oak. The flavors are rich and decadent. Damn good!!!
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 A really nice version from the breakfest series of Mikkeller. Actually enjoyed the not bourbon barrel more but still a very good beer.

Aromat to mieszanka gorzkiej czekolady, wyraźnej wanilii i kokosa. W tle lekko drewniane nuty. 
W smaku bardzo pełne, geste i słodsze niż podstawowa wersja. Czekolada, kawa, i mega intensywna wanilia z kokosem. Smakuje jak słodkie pralinki z alkoholem.

Alkohol:  13% obj. 
 Dodatki:  Kawa (1%), Wanilia (0,7%) 
 Data butelkowania:  05.09.2016 
 Data ważności:  05.09.2026 
 Kolor:  Czarny z ciemnobrązowymi prześwitami u podstawy piany. 
 Piana:  Beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niska.
Przy nalewaniu z góry nie pozwala się wznieść na wyżej niż 2 cm.
Zatrzymuje się na poziomie 2 milimetrów.
Po zakręceniu szkłem odbudowuje się nieznacznie.
Lacing tylko minimalny. 
 Zapach:  Monstrualnie beczkowy! Pachnie nadzwyczajnie. Przepotężna porcja wanilii, oraz kokosa. Po nosie uderzają akcenty mokrego drewna, dębowej beczki.
Długo trzeba dochodzić do siebie po pierwszych aromatach.
Baza w postaci kawy, mlecznej czekolady i karmelu została bardzo ładnie zbudowana.
Piwo jest tylko minimalnie palone.
Arcymistrzowski aromat! 
 Smak:  Oh My God! Kokos jest tutaj obłędny. Wszelkie skojarzenia z bounty w płynie są jak najbardziej słuszne. Vanilla Shake ma posmaki mleczka kokosowego, ciasteczek kokosanek, lodów waniliowych, ciastek z wiórkami kokosowymi.
Wanilia beczkowa jest tutaj bardzo intensywna. 
Wtórują jej czekoladowe, kawowe i karmelowe posmaki.
Wpływ kawy jest jednoznaczny. 
Z pewnością nie jest to mocne, palone espresso, a raczej słodkie Caffè Latte.
Całość piramidy smaków 
zamyka subtelna paloność.
Alkohol jest gładziutki, kompletnie niewyczuwalny. Tekstura dość gęsta, ale jak na piwo tej klasy nie jest oleista.
Pełne w smaku, kremowe na języku, aksamitne na podniebieniu.
Klasa mistrzowska!
Nic dodać nic ująć. Warte swojego "fame" xD 
 Wysycenie:  Minimalne. Dokładnie w punkt. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Mikkeller Vanillia Shake Bourbon Barrel Aged.

Piwo o którym krążyły legendy. Sam musiałem się sporo natrudzić, żeby je zdobyć. Ludzie na grupach piwnych wymian żądali za niego najwyżej klasy amerykańskich RIS-ów.
W końcu udało się kupić VS w Mikkeller Shopie w cenie 125 DKK (ok.75 zł.).
Cena dość wysoka za małą butelkę trunku, jednak warta każdej wydanej złotówki (w tym przypadku korony duńskiej xD).
Najwyższej klasy trunek i myślę, że Top3 europejskich RIS-ów.
Uwarzone w norweskim Lervig w Stavanger.
Nie przypadkowo ich Imperial Stout - "3 Bean Stout" należy do mojego Top3 ze Starego Kontynentu.
Mała ciekawostka: na etykiecie widnieje napis: "Product of Norway" xD

Piwo wybitnie bourbonowe, gdzie akcenty whiskey, mokrego drewna, dębiny przeplatają się z gigantyczną porcją kokosa i wanilii.
Trunek pachnie obłędnie, a smakuje nieziemsko.
Wprowadza w osłupienie kubki smakowe.
Dodatkowo alkohol jest tak gładki jak w jakimś niskoekstraktywnym stoucie.

Chapeau bas! Dla Mikkellera! Tym piwem udowodnili swoją bezsprzeczną wielkość na europejskim rynku piw craftowych.

Butelka zakupiona z Mikkeller Webshop

Leżakowana wersja podstawowej wersji waniliowego szejka. Beczka po bourbonie zrobiła mega robotę. Piwo samo w sobie było już mega waniliowe, ale beczka jeszcze bardziej uwydatniła ten dodatek. Jak na stout to sporo ciała. 
W smaku poza wspomnianą wanilią dochodzi kawa, czekolada i kokos.
Top 3 europejskich piw!

Bottle shared with brahs, care of Jim. Pours a dark brown shade with small sized head. Nose and flavor of campfire marshmallow, vanilla bean, fudge, coffee, and some more lucky charm style marshmallows. Medium to fuller mouth, not overly sticky/viscous. Warming in belly but not overly hot in the profile. Very well done for a sweet imperial stout.

The marriage between the barrel and the beer is just stupendous.The essence and flavour of the base beer cannot be trounced by the barrel but they mesh perfectly to create sonething new without either losing what they brong to the brew. Not much head but full but not stipidly big but strong and balanced umong all that potential weight.
Better than BCBS IMHO.

Bottle. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, vanilla, liqourice, coffee. Loads of vanilla and chocolate. Bourbon notes. Wood. Complex. Starts heavy sweet and finish light bitter with lingering bourbon notes. Smooth. Heavy and creamy. A great one...

Bottle. It pours jet black with a creamy beige head. Loads of vanilla and bourbon in the aroma with sweet candy notes. The flavor is big roasted and chocolate with loads of vanilla and sweet malts. This is sweet but the bourbon makes this incredible!

A Vanilla Shake emlékei elevenen élnek bennem, s mivel az alap verzió az egyik legjobb sör volt, amit ittam, szinte el sem mertem képzelni, mire számítsak az ital bourbon hordóban történő érlelését követően. A palack felnyitását követően aztán még kevesebb esélyem maradt arra, hogy valamiféle egzakt képet alkossak erről a főzetről, ezt ugyanis objektíven nemigen állt módomban megtenni, mivel már az aromák fázisa is túlmutatott mindenen, ami a tapasztalatok alapján felmérhető lett volna: a szavak itt kevésnek bizonyulnak. A vanília szó nem képezi le ugyanis tökéletesen az élményt, amit az illatok nyújtanak, még akkor sem, ha egy tejszínes, Kinder csokoládés, kókuszos, kekszes, fehércsokis masszára csepegtetett bourbon vanília-esszenciáról beszélünk. A szerkezet aztán tökéletes terepét adja az aromák megelevenedésének, süteményes vaníliakrém, tejcsokoládé, színescukorkás fánkok vattacukros, parfümös zamata tölti be szánknak minden lehetséges szegletét; leírhatatlanul bársonyos, aromás alkoholköltemény. Elképzelni sem lehetne ízletesebb italt, melyet whisky csókolt homlokon, s ezáltal a mennyekbe emelkedett.

Bottle shared. Pours black with a small tan head. Loads of bourbon, vanilla, milk chocolate and coffee, roasted malts. Like a dessert. Very sweet, medium bitter. Full body, low carbonation.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of loads of bourbon, loads of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Black with tan head, not lasting. Taste is moderate+ sweet and light malt bitter. Full body, creamy feel and bourbon vanilla chocolate finish.

Bottle. Black in color with a tan head. Vanilla, wooden oak, some cocoa and notes of bourbon in aroma. Sweetish taste. Smooth mouthfeel. Some 

vanilla and chocolatey notes in taste, bit like a cake. Chocolate and bourbon later on. Quite rich on these flavors, nice though, not 

overpowered even theyre quite strongly present all the time. Well balanced with loads of vanilla and vinous bourbon coffee notes in the end. A 

sipper.

W aromacie ogrom wanilii, kokosa i pralin. Smak słodki, gesty, gładki, pełno mlecznej czekolady, pralin, kakao, vanilii, kokosa. To smakuje jak płynna mleczna czekolada z kokosem i wanilią, serio! Cudownie. Posmak kakaowy, długi i przyjemny z lekką goryczką. Wybitny imp stout.
Niesamowite. Deser. Mega słodka czekolada, potężny kokos, wanilia, Bourbon. Cudowne piwo.

The vanilla and nice whiskey balance out with a sweet barrel and a lovely vanilla. The flavor is lovely strong vanilla with a sweet meltiness, a good whiskey, and a great balance. The mouth feel is a little thin and light with a wonderful viscousness and a lingeringly sweet vanilla on the back end. Damn. This is awesome

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus for the reunion of Meat Cloud and the Bird Dicks. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, coffee, great. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, poured thin. Taste is vanilla crazy, roasted malt, coffee, booze, barrel, great. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, vanilla roasted malt aftertaste. Overall, solid. But not as good as regular.

Bottle @ Home. Pours very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma of sweet roasted malt, caramel, little coffee, dark chocolate, heavy vanilla, wood, bourbon. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, chocolate, loads of vanilla, light wood, bourbon, alcohol. Full body, oily mouthfeel, sweet finish with some warming alcohol. 031216
330-ml bottle from mikkeller beer club. huge boozy vanilla nose, head didnt come easily, intense in mouth, definite vanilla shake character, boozy, creamy. vanilla is the new chocolate.

33cl bottle thanks to Wing Maniac. It pours a pitch black viscous body with small brown head. Aroma is full on sweet and bold chocolatey notes, booze, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, vanilla. Taste is also sweet and boozy, very bold and rich with plenty more notes of coffee, vanilla, bourbon, booze. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, dessert beer

The aroma is full of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, caramel and cocoa nibs. The color is pitch black with no head at all. The taste is full of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, caramel, coffee, dried fruits such as dates, raisins and prunes along with some cocoa nibs. The finish is long and sweet with a nice layer of sweet bourbon on the tongue. A really nice beer and understandable that its so beloved among craft beer lovers. Even though its staggering 13 % alc. ABV I dont think you can smell or taste it. It gives you a nice and warm sensation down your throat and thats of course the high alcohol percentage. This is really like drinking a vanilla milkshake, nice!

B2 Had fond memories of B1 but they were honestly surpassed. Thick black pour with a creamy beige head. The nose is so vanilla and chocolate rich this is so sexy. Not over the top but damn rich and that translates perfectly into the taste where things climax in a fudgy, vanilla, slight coconut, slight bourbon explosion of flavours. The mouthfeel is rich with a suitable low carbonation. This is imho Mikkellers best offering by far and one of the very best stouts coming out of Europe.

Sista flaskan på Bishops, Örebro (Tack, Karin, för "prisvärd" öl!). Kolsvart med tunt, försvinnande, beiget skum. Stor söt doft med massor av vanilj, bourbon och choklad - väl integrerade med varandra! Tung, lite spritsig kropp, sticker lite på tungan. Rejält spritig i inledningen. När det väl lagt sig en aning kommer bourbonsmaken fram väldigt tydligt, för att sedan gå över och avslutas i mängder av choklad och vanilj. Nästan lite väl spritig i inledningen smakmässigt, tycks hålla ihop bättre i doften. Men väldigt lite att klaga på, det här var riktigt gott. Kan den kanske jämna ut sig något av att ligga ett tag?

Pitch black color with mocha head that fizzes away almost completely. Aroma has really nice bourbon integrated very well with the vanilla. Taste starts sweet with lots of vanilla, coconut, fudge, caramel, toffee, the bourbon is integrated extremely well. Finish lingers with bourbon, no real alcohol burn. Heavy body with medium carbonation. This might be the best Mikkeller beer I ever had.

Bottle. 
Pitch black, almost no head. Tiny tan. 
Nose is sweet, hints of bourbon and vanilla. Taste is classic stout, very round, vanilla and a sweet finish. 
Full body, soft carbonation. Awesome.

Bottle shared. Dark brown pour with a thin, flimsy tan head. Huge aroma notes of vanilla and bourbon, some cocoa and milk chocolate. Taste notes of vanilla, bourbon, just a hint of whiskey, caramel fudge, toffee, toasted coconut, a bit of chocolate, cocoa and just a hint of coffee. very well balanced, though just a tad on the spicy side on the aftertaste. Full body, medium carbonation and a smooth vanilla finish.

Bottle @ Brought by Vindueskigger. Pours black with a very small brown head. Aroma of vanilla, vanilla ice cream, bourbon, choko, light scent of coffee, fudgey caramel. Taste is heavy sweet, bourbon, choko, heavy vanilla, scent of wood. Vanilla wonderland!

A: Pitch black with a nutty brown coloured head that dissapates fast, leaving a thin lacing. N: Toffee, fudge, caramel, chocolate, brownie, soap, vanilla, bourbon, liqourice T: Liqourice, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, creme brulee, coffee, chocolate O: Very nice and thick mouthfeel! Extremly complex flavours on both nose and taste! Just a little bit boozy, but very very nice...
Vanilla, chocolate, coffee and bourbon (not too much surprisingly). Great beer (not surprisingly)
Very very good beer. One of the my favourite stout. Definitely try it again

Pitch black, small tan head fades away quite fast.
Fills the room with vanilla, bourbon, oak, cocoa, chocolate cake.
Taste is huge vanilla and bourbon. So smooth, got some heat to it and a little boozy in the finish. 
The hype is real!

(Mikkeller Beer Geek Vanilla Shake (Bourbon Edition)) Bottle 330 ml at home with a yellow wax. Served into a snifter, ABV 13%
Pours a thick beer, pitch black in colour, with a non-existent head, just a bit of dark brown foam sticking around the glass.
Smells great, lots of chocolate and vanilla, fudge, bourbon, chocolate cake, inviting alcohol, a touch of coffee somewhere on the back.
Great taste, lots of bourbon and vanilla on the front, followed by plenty of chocolate, fudge, mocca, a bit of alcohol but for the most part very well hidden, oats, a touch of coffee, some plums even, roasted malts on the finish and more bourbon.
Thick, full body with soft carbonation, very sticky on the palate.
Even more fantastic than the regular version.

Bottle bought at the mikkeller bar. Poured a fudgie dark black colour with a tanned ring on top. Aroma is just a piece of heaven. Big sweet natural vanilla notes, darkest sweet chocolate, charred oak, marshmallows, sweet bourbon notes, little big of heat, fudge and sticky caramel. The mouthfeel on this bad boy is just amazing. Liked it even more than vanilla rye of FO. By far the best mikkeller beer i have had.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong vanilla bean, cocoa, roast, wood. Thick body, chewy, strong vanilla light roast, chocolate, wood, hides the alcohol well, really enjoyed this.
Poured a very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma was big barrel, vanilla, dark fruits. Flavor similar, fudged and vanilla, a bit hot but way better than the original version

Bottle shared by Dan. Pours a thick inky black with no head. Looks like an oil sligh on top of the pour. Aromas of vanilla and dark fruits. Some alcohol. Taste is sweet with a vanilla middle and an alcohol burn at the finish. Way better than I expected.

Bottle enjoyed at Mikkeller Bar. Pours a viscous black body with no head. A swirl gives it a dark tanned film of foam. aroma is rich vanilla and bourbon. some alcohol is here along with an abundance of chocolate, cocoa and roasted malts. taste is sweet but not overly. roasted malts, vanilla and bourbon. some dark roasted coffee and loads of burnt sugars. this is pretty insane stuff. all the good flavors just masterly combined. Full body,sticky mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

30/XII/15 - 33cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a (was supposed to be on the cap, but cap was empty, under the wax) (2015-1830) Thanks to hackobock for the trade!
Clear dark brown to black beer, no head, high viscosity while pouring. Aroma: very sweet, caramel, lots of vanilla, mocha, crème brûlée, sugary, dark chocolate. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sourish, spicy, some cinnamon, dark chocolate, mocha, hoppy, lots and lots of vanilla, milk chocolate. Aftertaste: roasted, mocha, some coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla.
Bottle at tderoeck's place, thanks for sharing! Vanilla, roast, chocolate, sweet but pleasantly so, nice brew!

Bottle shared by Jack, thanks! Pours black with a thin light brown head that starts and remains at the edges. Aroma is full of sweet dark grains and strong vanilla with a bourbon note supporting. Flavor has a great combination of dark grains, sweet chocolate and vanilla with a hint of bourbon.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black. Motor oil-esque. Small brown head quickly fades to a ring around the glass. Bottle. Thanks Jacob. Pours black no head. Nose/taste of vanilla, bourbon, baked brownie, brownie batter, chocolate cake, toasted marshmallow, coffee and oak - Full bodied.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Brownie, chocolate, vanilla sweet aromas. Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, sweet malts, full on chocolate brownie.

Bottle with Wax, 13%. Black with no head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and bourbon. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dark chocolate, thick, vanilla, bourbon, little dry, warming, hop, little liquorice and medium bitter.

Bottle from Vinspecialisten, Aalborg. Black without head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, heavy vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily, smooth and soft. Imperial stout, vanilla and bourbon: The perfect mix. 270715
On tap at Mikropolis, Copenhagen. Pours black, small brownish head. Vanilla, licorice, milk chocolate. Roasted malts, wood. Full bodied and complex. Vanilla gives it smooth and silky character.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm. Black beer with an brownish head. Vanilla, licorice, figs, chocolate and caramel aroma. Bourbon, vanilla, caramell, Woody, dark fruits flavour. This is really a Lovely beer :-)

33cl bottle served in a snifter. Pitch black pour with a dark brown head which is there for the briefest moment. Aroma is massive vanilla and bourbon notes - nothing else gets a look in. I was a little concerned that the bourbon would impart an extra level of vanilla-ness on top of the already (almost) excessive vanilla shake. I neednt have worried. The bourbon barrels seemed to have created a much more harmonious balance and the coffee and chocolate are allowed to shine through more as a result. In short better in every way than the standard vanilla shake but whether the difference is worth 3x the price is very much down to the individual. Personally I would rather have 3x vanilla shakes but if the occasion warrants it this is hard to beat.
Draught @ Mikropolis. Obviously sweet, but in this version a bit too much for my liking. Notes of vanilla, coffee and milk chocolate.

Draft at mikropolis
black, brown head.
Salty aroma, coffee, smoke and vanilla.
Vanilla, coffee tastemedium sweet.
Fizzy.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends Reykjavik, pours black with a tiny beige / tan head. Nose brings out loads of vanilla, sweet bourbon, and loads of caramelized sweet sugar. Flavour is intense, with intensely sweet loads of vanilla, candied sugar, caramel and decadent bourbon. Desert-like sweetness, but not cloying at all. Phenomenal complexity. Superb.

Bottle with thanks to bursprak. Pours inky black, very small brown head, dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is pure desert, chocolate fudge with vanilla toffee topping. Flavor is full sweet, light bitter, huge waves of chocolate, vanilla, coconut and a bit of mellow bourbon. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Really good, but almost a bit too hedonistic after a while.

Bottle from Mikkeller online. Pours thick and black, super dense and oily, no head. Viscose. Aroma of chocolate breakfast cereal, if you took it with full-cream milk and Makers Mark. Very lightly carbonated, but just the right amount for the big body. Huge, rich flavour - bitter chocolate, treacle, licorice, chocolate syrup, cooking chocolate, cacao, vanilla cream and a bit of heat on the finish with more vanilla. Indulgent.

Nice pour with a thin tan head. Very dense aroma, Vanilla and Bourbon with wood and roast showing. Alcohol and fruit skins show with some molasses. Warming in the mouth with some alcohol. Vanilla and chocolate with dark fruit and Bourbon. Full bodied and warming.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Rating #2500. Bottle. Black oily pour, no head. Rich and strong aroma of vanilla, bourbon booze, sweet coffee and a bit of oak. Taste is overwhelmingly good. Very full and long evolving, with strong earthy vanilla, cofee, roasted malt, milk chocolate and a boozy bourbon finish with a little bitterness. Really amazing, world class beer.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 330ml Bottle, big thanks to Erik. Smell is beyond amazing. Like a Milky Way candy bar explosion. Taste is vanilla and bourbon. Some oak barrel. Roast and sweetness.  My only complaint is that its completely flat.

Bottle split 4 ways. Pitch black pour with a small dense mocha head. Nose is sweet, vanilla fudge, some chocolate and light roast. Taste is sweet as well, vanilla fudge, caramel, milk chocolate, light coffee notes and some roasted malts. Wonderful stuff!

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with almost no head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, light roasted malt and molasses. Flavour is sweet. Full bodied, thick texture, soft carbonation and boozy bourbon and vanilla finish.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 Draught
Black colour, beige head. Aroma of vanilla, lots of vanilla. Malts, light bourbon, coffee, chocolate. Bitter flavour, sweet malts, brown sugar, liquorice,  caramel, roasted malts. Finish vanilla, coffee, pronounced bourbon.8-4-8-4-16: 4.0
(From draught @ Mikkeller Bar Victoriagade. København visit, 2014)

BottlePitch black colour, tan head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, caramel, bourbon, lots of vanilla. Bitter coffee flavour, sweet malts, cacao, caramel, roasted malts, vanilla. Full body, thick, quite alcoholic. Finish vanilla, bourbon, coffee and cacao. Nice.9-4-8-5-16: 4.2
(from 33cL bottle -was initially under the impression I was opening a normal vanilla until I read about the wax- @ home)

330 ml waxed bottle from Mikkeller Webshop.
Black, oily body, with a tiny, creamy, dark brown head.
Delicious, sweet aroma of vanilla, milk chocolate, coco, bourbon.
Tastes of booze, bourbon, choclate, coco, vanilla, barrel notes, dried fruits some bitter coffee.
Full, slick, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes boozy, alcohol warming, with bourbon, bitter chocolate, coffee, subtle vanilla and long-lasting wooden barrel notes.

Tasty! While the nose is just amazing, the taste is a bit too boozy for my liking, although still enjoyable and complex. Overall a delicious, heavy, thick and sweet Stout, to sip slowly, but not my favourite Imperial Stout from Mikkeller.

33cl gold waxed bottle. This is something I guess that costs a bazillion dollars to get in the US. It is not worth that. Black pour, huge vanilla tones dominate, some coffee, cocoa, and soy as well. Bourbon adds nicely to the base beer but it isnt something that is blowing me away.

Bottle from Vinspecialisten Aalborg shared with daje
Pours pitch black with a thin tanned head. Smell of choco pop, vanilla, bourbon and loads of chocolate sauce and soy sauce. Heavy heavy sweet, a bit fat actually, chocolate sauce, dark malts blended with bourbon and vanilla. This feels like dessert! Good beer; maybe a bit too chocolate laden for me

Draught at All In Beerfest, 2014. Pitch black, small brown head. Looks like used motor oil! Aroma is sweet vanilla, coffee beans and bourbon tones. Taste is coffee, vanilla, bourbon, slight alcohol in the finish but not dominant. Big body, medium carbo, very oily and thick texture. Like a stand alone dessert, like a cake and coffee with avec in one.

Good beer and old football games with Mads. Jet black with a small tan head. Intense and absolutely wonderful aroma, of chocolate, vanilla, caramel, coffee and bourbon. Sweet, intense flavour with loads of dark chocolate, dried fruit, vanilla, bourbon and vineous alcohol.

Bottle @ Denmark-Sovjet, 1985. World Cup Mexico Qualification. Shared with Christian. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Vanila, fudge, syrup, coffee, chocolate. Heavy vanilla .. again. Good coffee, vinousness and soy. Sweet. But a lot of quality!
Draught at AIBF 2014 session 4 cons 2014-11-15 Göteborg AR: vanilla beans, sugar AP: oily dark brown, wee head F: thick sugary body, bourbon vanilla, bourbon spicey
On tap at aibf2014. Black with tanned head. Smell is vanilla and bourbon. Taste is sweet malty with vanilla, bourbon and some coffee and roasted malt. Sweet with low bitterness and low carbonation.

Tap at mikkeller bar. Black color, small brown head. Aroma is nicely roasted, coffee, full body, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is full body, coffee, vanilla, chocolate.

Draught at Mikkeller, black sensation. Smell reminds very much of a milkshake together with some vanilla and chocolate. Pours black with a small beige head. Taste is very smooth vanilla with some coffee and chocolates. Palate is oily yet easy. Overall a really good beer with a nice composition.

330 ml bottle at home. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, wood, vanilla, dark fruits. Taste is sweet and light bitter same as the aroma, dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Full body, oily, soft to flat carbonation.
Bottle. Color black with a small brown head. Aroma vanilla, bourbon, caramel. Taste very sweet, vanilla, caramel, liqourice.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Second time I am having this beast. I got a big glass of this monster and it wasnt even too much. Pours like motor oil with a tan lacing on top. Aroma is just BOOM in ya face with lots of vanilla, bright milky chocolate, sweet and rich bourbon notes, butterscotch, brownie, fudge and a hint of fresh coconut. Wow this is slick! The taste is slick and has lots of chocolate notes, vanilla, butterscotch, liquorice, a decent amount of roasted malts and with a big smooth body.  A big and perverse treat!

Aroma - good, god.. this beer is brilliant in every single way. The most majestic aroma you could ever ask for from a BBA IOS that screams, Im stronger and better than all.

Appearance - darker than Darth Vader, this brew is as dark as they come--literally pitch black and viscous like the bottom of a bottle of Castrol GTX. If you dont drive hard, this beer is not for you. 

Taste - for the style, I do not know where to start, here. This stout stands out among its peers. It is brilliant. I have never tasted anything as close to vanilla bourbon in my entire life. I doubt FFFs DL Vanilla Bourbon supersedes what Mikkellers BBA Vanilla Shake is advertising. Let me put it this way, after drinking this, I honestly do not have much of a desire to try FFFs BBA DL VB stout. This did it for me. I could not be happier w/ how this beer matures over time in the bottle and in my glass! Every sip is purely a work of art. 

Palate - an explosion of vanilla, espresso, chocolate, oatmeal, and subtle, smooth bourbon on the finish. You would never know this is 13%. This beer is as close to perfect as they come in every single way. I just wish it was easier to come across. 

Overall, I envisage this brew will forever remain in my top ten beers of all time (and stouts are not even my favorite style). I drink a lot of world-class beer, too. Mikkeller, please, whatever you do, keep doing you. This was nothing shy of a magnificent beer.
user_location: The Garden of the Beer Gods, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle (330 ml). Thanks to Johan for this one! Pitch black with a small dark brown head and little lacing. Aroma is of vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, light fruitiness and sweetness. Taste is quite sweet with vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt and dark fruits. Medium/full body. Medium carbonation. A tad creamy mouthfeel. Lingering sweet finish with a little warming presence. Enticing aroma, but the sweetness + vanilla + alcohol make it a little cloying. Quite tasty. Lack a bit of balance. Interesting.

3300th rating. Bottle shared with Tom at hotel tasting. Opaque black pour with thin brown foam. Aroma is very decadent and rich, tons of vanilla, rich bourbon notes, very cakey, cocoa beans . Taste is sweet, chocolaty, tons of vanilla, really rich desserty chocolate, very desserty. Palate is rich, coating, very sweet with med-light carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Rating no. 400! 33 cl bottle. Pours pitch Black with almost no head. Aroma.. Oh jeez.. The milk chocolate. The vanilla. The bourbon. "Kinderæg". Slight roast, but i Almost cant tell that its beer. Taste has more roast, but again this sweet vanilla, coconut, almost no alcohol, cinnamon, slight licorice and salt, huge milk- and White chocolate. So much candy. Kids would love this. Sticky and low carb. Oh Lord! For an European stout, this is so flavorfull and smooth. crazy good! Only thing that pulls Down is appearance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours black with almost no head. Just a slight little fuzz. Aromas of lots of bourbon, vanilla, butter, light chocolate, light coffee notes, fudge and filled chocolates. Taste is bourbon, looots of milk chocolate, some coffee roast, toffee. God damn.

Bottle. Pours a jet black body with a small dark brown head. Nose is coffee, vanilla, wood, chocolate, caramel, licorice, dark malts, bourbon, alcohol and hints of coconut, soy and charcoal. Taste is vanilla, bourbon, coconut, sweet dark malts, chocolate, coffee, hints of caramel, syrup and wood. Full body, soft carbonation. Very, very nice.
Bottle thanks to AntonFred. Poured thick black with a wisp of dark tan head. Aroma of sweet vanilla marshmallow choc. Very light carb med bod. Taste of bitter dark choc pretzel.

On tap @ Ma che siete venuti a fà. Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma leggera, abbastanza persistente. Al naso sentori prepotenti di cioccolato e vaniglia, ossidazione, leggero caffettoso, alcol ben presente. In bocca si taglia a fette col coltello, cioccolatosa, dolce, stucchevole, piatta. A dispetto della sua rarità e del suo punteggio su ratebeer, è una birra abbastanza modesta, rozza e grossolana, non adatta a palati fini.

Aroma of chocolate, molasses, peat, coffee and vanilla. Taste is chocolate, peat, coffee, vanilla, slight smoke. Very well hidden abv and pure candy. Its delicious if u are on the sweet side. Try it with a stout - chocolate cake and enjoy. Or with ice cream

Bottle shared by Dave with epic. Aroma is dark vanilla bean, coffee, and thick molasses. Pours black with a very feint dark brown lacing. Taste is vanilla beans, oak, molasses, bourbon and a roasty dark chocolate finish. Syruppy mouthfeel helps keeps these delicious tastes in my mouth. Truly a beer worth savoring.

Pour is viscus black with a very small off-white head that fades into a ring quickly. Aroma is extremely sweet - vanilla extract, oak, dark caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, and slight booze. Flavor is slight bourbon heat at first and transitions into a vanilla and chocolate finish. Alcohol is fairly well hidden considering its strength.

Bottle shared as a post-Borefts 2014 road soda. Pours new black with a beige head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, wood chocolate, fudge, liquorice (but thankfully a lot less than the regular vanilla shake) and a little coffee. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 Aroma of dark chocolate and raisins. Taste of dates, dark chocolate, raisins and vanilla. Dry and full bodied. No head

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 Bottle shared with and courtesy of Kermis.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear Black pour. Loads of vanilla. Very well done.

Kolsvart utan något skum. Doftar massor med vanilj, choklad och kaffe. Smakar vanilj!!, mörkt rostat kaffe, choklad och sjukt fyllig med lite kolsyra, väldigt söt men balanserad och ingen alkoholsmak! Grymt bra!!

Bottle kindly shared by esp0r, september 5th 2014. Black body with a small beige head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, wood. Sounds simple, is tremendous. Taste adds licorice, a clear bourbon presence, the vanilla seems to be milder here than in the regular edition. Light alcohol burn in finish, bourbon notes grows towards the finish, resulting in a sweet roasty vanilla bourbon aftertaste. What an excellent beer!
Bottle share. Thanks AGAIN GothGargoyle! Poured out thick. Aroma of vanilla, mocha, bourbon, wood. Taste is sweet, with a late bitterness. Long dry finish. Sticky creamy palate.

Solid black with a small dark chocolate head. Aroma is massive vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, cocoa, sweet coffee, fudge brownie. Full bodied, viscous mouthfeel, sweet and boozy on the palate with a sticky finish. Taste is vanilla, bourbon, cocoa powder, hint of coffee, more bourbon and vanilla. Great sipper.

Fra fat på Cardinal, Brewers Night (heldige oss som har Cardinal!): svart med litt brunt skum. Vanlije, sjokolande, kaffe i en herlig blanding med cremet munnfylde og lang ettersmak. Som den beste hjemmelagede sjokolademousse - snop og dessert fra første til siste dråpe. Heldige oss som også har Mike på Lervig.

Served alongside the standard version.

Pitch black body with a small beige head. The aroma brings everything along from the standard version with the addition of oak and a delectable bourbon scent. Rich and thick. Palate coating. vanilla, chocolate, coffee all balanced elegantly with an out front bourbon presence. Dangerously easy to drink for a 13% abv brew. While Vanilla Shake was tasty, the BA Vanilla Shake is superb.

On tap at Cardinals Brewers Night. Pours almost black with a small tanned head. Very strong aroma of vanilla. Taste is hefty sweet,vanilla en mass, caramel and melasse.Thick oily mouthfeel. Lingering sweet goodies.

On tap @ Cardinal, Stavanger, Brewers night. Pours pitch black with a short lived mocha head. Aroma is, well yes, sweet f... vanilla, as well as chocolate, sweet liquorice, coffee and wooden barrels. Full velvety creamy body with no carbonation. Flavour is sweet, and did I mention sweet, with vanilla, bourbon barrels, tobacco and chocolate. Lingering vanilla finish. Sweet and over the top, just the way it should be.
DWF, fat på Cardinals Brewers Night,Svart med mørkt skum.Smak av vanilla, bourbon, sjokolade, kaffe. Smak av vanilje, kaffe, malt, sjokolade. Mild of fin. Kanongod.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2014 Black. Brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla and wood. Similarly fine taste combined with bitterness. Dark chocolate, vanilla and wood in afterstaste. Very well balanced. Strong in taste and alcohol.

On tap at Cardinal during Brewers Night, Black with a brown rim. Vanilla and chocolate dominate the nose with notes of bourbon. Chokolate, coffee, vanilla and sweet and salty liquorice flavors. Full bodied and oily smooth to drink. Long pleasant finish.

On tap at Cardinals big Brewers Night, Pitch black colour, moderate tan head. Intense aroma of vanilla, bourbon, chocolate and oak. Sweet flavour with nearly overwhelming notes of vanilla, also roasted malts, coffee and chocolate, bourbon and oak again, but the hops are very moderate.

Bottle bought @ The Mikkeller Webshop. Pours slightly viscous pitch black with a thin dark mocha head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is intense, sweet and malty with roasted malts, dark chocolate, vanilla beans, toffee, caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, roasted coconut, bourbon, dark roast coffee, sweet liquorice candy and alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, salty, tiny sour and malty with roasted malts, toffee, burnt caramel, vanillin, hay, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt wood, vanilla fudge, walnuts, toasted coconut and bourbon alcohol. Mouthfeel is fat, oily, viscous, astringent and full bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter, salty and malty with roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, vanillin, charred wood, bourbon, salty liquorice candy and alcohol. Smell promises a lot but taste is slightly too salty for me.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Bottle shared by Tony at capitol beer. And taproom pours motor oil black with cream head. Taste is vanilla shake. Fits the name perfectly. Amazing. One of the best ive ever had
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, chocolate, taste is sweet, toffee, vanilla, chocolate.
Bottle, thanks J-Dawg. Black with brown head. The aroma is ridiculous, massive vanilla and chocolate. Yaste of rich vanilla, chocolate and coffeee. Thick and sweet, just like me

Bottle @ Mads. Dark brown, almost pitch black, no head or lacing. Nice coating. Aroma, roasted malts, milk chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, brown sugar, alcohol, oak. Taste, roasted malts, oak, bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, alcohol, chocolate, liquorice notes. Quite bitter roasted aftertaste. Dry mouth feel.

Finally got around to buying another of these... Oh well, it is friday after all. 
Pour is almost pitch black, with some reddish hues, and virtually no head. If you put your back into it, a small mocha brown head can appear...
The aroma has a lot going on. Plenty of vanilla, roasted coffee beans, oatmeal, milky chocolate, bourbon, caramel, cookie dough, brownie fudge, roasted malts, toasted coconut, slight leathery notes, faint wood. This shit is pretty darn delicious, and quite complex. 
The taste is somewhat of a sweet monster. Some roasted bitterness in here as well, but its dominantly sweet. 
Medium bodied, but has that oatmeal characteristics making this fell a little thicker, with a semi flat carb.. pretty dope for sure...

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Mikkeller Beer Geek Vanilla Shake (Bourbon Edition) ].Clear dark black brown color with virtually no head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dark chocolate, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, wood. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20140131]

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 Black with no head, viscous. Aroma is amazingly perfect - smells sweet with a chocolate mud cake brownie vibe, mild spice, vanilla, barrel, cookies, marzipan. Taste is coffee bitterness up front, bourbon vanilla sweetness, marzipan, dark chocolate dry finish. Palate though not heavy and thick is a lingering dark chocolate flavour. A killer dessert beer. Definitely by far Mikkellers greatest creation - staggeringly good. Only thing it is missing is a very full body.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm. Pirch black beer with a small brownish/beige head. Vanilla and caramel aroma, licorice, figs, raisins, slightly vinous, prunes, milk chocolate, cocoa, hazelnuts, some grapes. Roasted bourbon flavor, vanilla, woody, raisins, licorice, caramel, prunes, some dades and grapes, chocolate, warming alcohol but still its well hidden, salty, hazelnuts, tar notes, some vinous notes. Roasted chocolate finish with vanilla, bourbon, licorice and figs. Excellent, the bourbon adds alot to this beer and makes it alot more complex.

This is insanely good! Pours black with a small, dense brown head. Vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, oak, dark sugar aroma. Taste is sweet dark sugars, chocolate, vanilla. I could actually just sit and smell this beer for the duration of the night and still be more than happy.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 Batch 1:  (10/4/10/5/17) 4.6

Very oily, no head whatsoever, shaking it around doesnt improve the head retention. Aroma of extreme vanilla, deep milk chocolate with dark chocolate, some bourbon but mostly very empowering vanilla. Taste of vanilla, chocolate, some licorice, quite sweet, lactose, bourbon, oak, more vanilla.


Batch 2: 8/4/7/3/16

Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, milk chocolate, bourbon, a bit boozy, soy sauce. Taste of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, butterscotch, very layered and spritzy, flavors havent came together whatsoever. Mouthfeel is noticably thinner, more pronounced bourbon, and less integrated vanilla. Significantly worse than the first batch, but still good.

33 cl. bottle. Thanks Kai. Yellow wax. Pours black with just a hint of a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and bourbon. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and bourbon. Very rich and sweet. I might like the regular version a touch better, but this is very good.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade, 12.12% ABVPitch black, oily, with no head. Strong aroma of chocolate block, hot chocolate, very real; some vanilla, chilies. The mouthfeel is very thick, full bodied, round; strong chocolate flavor, with an excellent accent of tobacco; some leather, liquorice and tar, very rich; fairly sweet but also strongly bitter, to balance; a bit more roasted malt in the final but luckily still dominated by the chocolate.Very good, another smack-in-the-face beer.

Mydude SaulTBauls with the hookup! 
Pours very black with a very thin touch of head. 

The aroma is huge & sweet, its got lots of vanilla & chocolate with some nice coffee like roastiness. 

The flavor is just huge with a bunch of dark chocolate & espresso. The beer is plenty sweet & plenty boozy but with a very nice bitterness to bring some balance. Its got a well integrated bourbon character thats not overwhelming at all, its got some vanilla, plum, & caramel. 

Really neat.

Thick oily pour no head black pour nearly nil carbonation aromas lovely mix of lactose bourbon vanilla creamy chocolate fudge cocoa mild liquorice the flavours creamy lactose vanilla chocolate mix with the bourbon lovely sweetness dark chocolate lactose good balance with a medium bitter dark fruit raisin plums citrus the finish like the original this is even better the bourbon touch is great lactose creaminess grain notes malt sweetness lasting bitter touch simply beautiful

Bottle, 06/08/2014. Pours thick oily black, nearly no head, bit of tan haze on the surface with a thin ring of lacing. Aroma is a smooth melange of coffee, dark roast poking through, chocolate caramel, vanilla bourbon. Taste is sweet caramel and chocolate. dark fruit swirled in, bitter ground roast coffee to balance, creamy vanilla on top, nice smooth bourbon finish. Thick, smooth creamy body. Delicious stuff.

Enjoyed on tap at Mikkeller Bar in Stockholm, SW. The bartender described this as "stupid good" and I completely agree with him. Appearance is pure pitch black with an oil like consistency and a thin dark tan rim around the glass. Aroma of huge chocolate, vanilla, and lactose notes with the great bourbon backing and a bit of wood barrel, super decadent and sweet, and smells incredible. Taste is just phenomenal, very rich, goes down like a milkshake, has a nice burn in the back end, still sweet. Really fantastic one here, definitely up there with others in the style, and my favorite beer geek brew to date.

Aroma: Big vanilla nose with dark chocolate syrup
Appearance: black with thin layer of tan head
Taste: vey Sweet malty with a subtle bourbon flavor and tons of vanilla and a hint of black licorice

Overall: incredibly smooth and a special treat for bourbon and vanilla lovers like myself

On tap. Pours black with minimal head. Aromas of milk chocolate and vanilla. Flavors of dark chocolate syrup, dark chocolate paste, and dark cocoa. Yep. Chocolate liquor extreme with malts to provide body. Cant find the bourbon - no mind.

(My 1000th rating) 33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, roasted malt, pepper, and coffee - with a bitter finish. ABV is fairly well-hidden.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. No head. Pitch black body. Lovely seet roasted malt cocoa aroma. Roasted malt coffee vanilla flavor. Smooth and pleasant in spite of the high alcohol contents. Little hops bitternes. Long dry finish. Impressive.

On tap at mikkeller stefans. Black with brown head. Aroma intense and massive; coffee, vanilla, alcohol, bourbon, roasted notes with a smooth and pleasant impression. Taste of coffee, molasses, bourbon, wood, vanilla, coffee and sugars. Big, sweet, smooth and pleasant.
På Mikkeller bar stefansgade. Doftar som en efterrätt. Vanilj, choklad och härlig bourbon. Tung. Viss strävhet finns mot slutet.

[4/30/14] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Black with a thick and creamy brown head. Wonderful aroma full of dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and some espresso. Sweet flavor with lots of chocolate, vanilla, a bit of dark fruits, bourbon, some espresso with coffee and a drier burnt finish. Full trhick creamy and silky mouthfeel. An amazing Imperial Stout.

Draught sample at Mikkeller and Friends (Stefansgade). Pours black with a coffee crema like head, crazy aroma of chocolate, caramel, toffee, bourbon and vanilla, flavor of coffee, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, toffee, fruits, full bodied, outstanding.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Black with a ring of brown head. Quite a bit going on in the aroma. Tastes of coffee, molasses, barrel influence too. If vanilla is there its smothered by everything else. Very sweet and really thick and oily. Very tasty beer for those with a sweet tooth but Id struggle with a larger measure.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, muscovado, dark fruit, almost chocolate chip cookies. Taste is very boozy, initial port barrel and dried fruit followed by bourbon finish. A bit too much. Body is rich, creamy and sticky.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is lots of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, oak and subdued roasted malt notes. Taste is moderate+ sweet and near moderate bitter. Body is full, texture is smooth and thick, carbonation is soft. Finishes sweet with roasted malt and lots of vanilla.

Tap at the Mikkeller and fiends bar... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Soft rich chocolate roast.. Light vanilla nose.. Big chocolate roast... Dark malts... Rich deep roast malt... Big bourbon... Soft milky vanilla... Sweet vanilla chocolate linger

Pitch black. Creamy root beer float head. Huge coffee forward nose. Chocolate and cotton candy. Incredibly roasty. Like espresso bean astringent. Its very medicinal. Chocolate undertones. Id say the bourbon is good but its not mind blowing.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours pitch black color with a small beige head. Perfect cocoa-chocolate-vanilla mesh on the nose, mild licorice and tear also. Chocolate and vanilla on the flavor, cocoa, bourbon and wood also. Creamy smooth palate. Excellent.
7427

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Aroma is fulfilled with sweet cocoa and vanilla. Flavour has cocoa, vanilla, alcohol and some rubbery tones. Finishes with salty licorice and herbal tones. Also some slightly stinging bourbon. Excellent.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of biscuit, some chocolate, vanilla and baking powder. Flavour of rich roasted malts, vanilla sugar, baking powder, mild wooden tartness and caramel sweetness. Full bodied and a sticky, roasty, wooden finish. The baking powder notes are rather disturbing, but overall the beer is balanced.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen

Pours pitch black with a small sticky brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, loads of vanilla, hints of oak, wood, syrup, dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste is heavy, complex and sweet with massive amounts of vanilla, some oak, cocoa, dark chocolate and cocoa. Finish is smooth, complex and roasty with loads of vanilla and woody notes. Quite a dessert. Very heavy slow sipper, but oh so tasty.

Awesome coffee, chocolate, and vanilla nose. Pours thick oily black with no carbonation whatsoever. Super thick mouthfeel with flavors of chocolate, vanilla, and roasty coffee (on the back end). Top notch brew.

Bottle bought from Mikkeller online shop, shared at home.
Appearance: black, minimal head. 
Aroma: vanilla, coffee, chocolate, caramel, licorice, mocca, leather, slight woody note.
Taste: heavy sweetness, medium and longlasting bitterness.
Palate: full body, thick and oily, sticky, long finish. Soft carbonation.
Overall: Vanilla dominating, very very sweet, balanced bitterness. Great nose on this one, but way too sweet for my tongue, close to sickening after a while, one bottle is more than enough.
Really heavy vanilla extract aroma. Flavor a lot less like this, kind of just a generic oatmeal/sweet stout with a bit of bourbon. Drinkable, nice aroma, not amazing overall though.
Pours jet black, like oil with no head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, peat, coffee and vanilla. Taste is chocolate, peat, coffee, vanilla, slight smoke. Very chewy, so good

Bottle. Pours thick black with a minimal dark brown head. Lots of vanilla and bourbon coconut, dark chocolate, cocoa, brownies, light wood, sugar. Full body, syrupy texture, near flat carbonation, Heavy sweet and medium bitter. Not rough or boozy, but very thick and sticky and kind of a dessert in itself. Went well with a muffin, though. Make that two muffins. Still, its a challenging and over the top drink that comes with a heavy price tag.

Thick black pour, tan head. Nose is somewhat artificial vanilla, chocolate, bourbon soaked fruits. Taste is vanilla, bourbon, some chocolate. Velvety smooth mouthfeel. Had this with Bourbon Vanilla Dark Lord and Vanilla Eclipse and this was much better than the Vanilla Eclipse. Very enjoyable.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, big thanks to Kenwold, 27/03/14. 
Pitch black with a moderate tan covering that soon clears.
Nose is rich, dollops of chocolate, light spice, vanilla, molasses, subtle bourbon, light smoke.
Taste comprises rich chocolate, bourbon, vanilla fudge, rum & raisen chocolate, pinch of spice.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, oily and semi vicous on the palate, subtle booze in the close.
This one delivers, solid impy, alcohol well integrated, barrel ageing just right.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
@ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm: Stor doft av nutella. Riktig rå vaniljsmak med en mycket fin fatton i eftersmaken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

27th March 2014Tasting at Bruces. Opaque black brown beer, small tan head. Nice chocolate vanilla nose. Palate is smooth and semi dry. Very light carbonation. Rich dark chocolate and a little vanilla. Tangy fruity bourbon and light dark malt. Smooth finish. Lovely!

Bottle shared in London - huge thanks to Kenny for this gem. Pours thick, deep black-brown with a bubbly, tan head. Rich aroma, lots of dark chocolate, chocolate cake, roast, coconut, dark fruits. Medium to big sweet flavor, pretty decadent, lots of fudge, hefty chocolate, torched marshmallows, slight earth and alcohol. Full bodied with fine carbonation and oily texture. Warm finish with bittersweet cocoa, burnt wood, chewy fudge, scorched earth. Absolutely delicious. Incredibly well balanced. Superb.
Poured at the tasting before Huna, Rich as hell pour, thick and creamy. Nearly black. Bourbon and vanilla overload with tons of brownie batter. My kind of stout!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Mark! Completely black oil, super thick looking with nearly no head, only a modest, thin, tan ring after an aggressive pour. Aroma is insane... Holy shit... Thick brown sugar, chocolate brownie batter topped with huge, sweet vanilla drizzle, notes of coffee cake, fudge-y morsels, burnt toffee, oatmeal cookies, maple syrup, & a super-smooth undercurrent of mild bourbon & wood. I could smell this for days. Taste is a total dessert beer... Vanilla frosted chocolate cake, more notes of oatmeal cookies with a dense, sweet coffee bean finish. Cocoa nibs, sticky maple, marshmallow fluff, extremely smooth/tame bourbon & light tannins, & just a kiss of dark fruit in the finish. Sticky mouth coating aftertaste, lingering notes of toffee, brown sugar, creamy coffee, vanilla... I could go on for days. Lovely mouth feel; oily, smooth, low carbonation, slightly sticky. This was one expensive bottle, but in my opinion, very worth it. Wonderfully complex, perfect sweetness without ever being cumbersome... Incredible beer.

A small taste on tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours pitch black with a dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, bourbon and alcohol. Excellent.

Bottle shared by Tommy. Thanks so much bro! Awesome beer for a milestone rating. I never do this. Super dark muddy brown with a small tan head. Nose is incredible. Super chocolateyamazing smell, full on cholate assault without a hint of any boozy or off flavors. I am super impressed. Flavor is incredible some maple, lots of chocolate, vanilla, latte, oh man this might be the best stout Ive ever had. Wow.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm opening. 

Black with a small tan head. I really liked the aroma of this one, sweet with a lot of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and toffee. The taste was also good although not as good as the aroma. Fairly thick and sticky mouthfeel. A very nice beer.
Milk chocolate aroma, powerful flavour with vanilla dark chocolate and some coffee notes. Small brown head. Very balanced beer with no obvious flaws.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Pours black with a small, dense brown head. Vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, oak, dark sugar aroma. Taste is sweet dark sugars, chocolate, vanilla. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, average carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Draft @ opening of Mikkeller Bar Stockholm.
App: Thick viscous black with a thick brown head.
Aroma: Big thick and sweet roasted aroma with lots of chocolate, vanilla, cacao and woody cofee. The bourbon is soft.
Taste: Big sweet chocolaty vanilla heaven with dry dusty cocoa powder on top. The bourbon is not too prominent and mostly gives depth.
Palate: Thick, creamy, sticky and smooth.
Overall: Wow. Really nice!

On tap at opening of Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Pors pitch black with a very low tan head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, honey, oak, nuscovado sugar, dark fruit. Taste is vanilla, honey, bourbon, roasted malts, dark fruits, muscovado sugar. Mouthfeel is smooth and sticky. Aftertaste is vanilla, honey, muscovado, dark fruit. Just fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of vanilla, wood, chocolate, coffee, licorice and raw sugar. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and wood. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really nice.
Bottle shared at Pegs. Dark brown pour with no real head. Vanilla aromas. Big bourbon, dark roasted malts, and bitter chocolate notes. Not as good as the base beer IMHO. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle. My much-awaited post-exam treat. Expectations are seriously high because the base beer was just amazing. Thick black pour with no head forming. Aroma - lots of vanilla and bourbon, chocolate, sweet. Very sniffable. Body is medium to big, smooth and rich. Taste - much more liquorice sweetness than the base beer, bourbon is well integrated and brings a little spice, still carries chocolate notes but the vanilla and coffee seem to be left behind by the bourbon. Some high notes of lime. Sweetness is quite pronounced. Some very good features to this. The base beer is £10 cheaper and, in my opinion, nicer.  This one is too sweet to the extent that it gets tiring.

33cl, at 13%Vol, as Mikkeller Beer Geek Vanilla Shake (with golden wax), new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2013, with coffee and vanilla, thx alot to Mikkel and team!, very complex sweet Stout, heavily roasted/bitter and slightly fruity/spicy, balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good brew
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar 8/2-2014. Vanilj, choklad, brända toner, mörk malt, hög sötma, rejält fyllig, oljig konsistens.

Mikkeller Beer Geek Vanilla Shake (Bourbon Edition)
Duft: kakao. vanilje. stor sødme
Smag: stor malt sødme. salt, kakao. vanilje. en smule sprit i eftersmag som kun er ganske svag. rosin, en smule brand smag. men sødmen dækker meget af det mørk malt

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph. Pours completely opaque black with a small, creamy, brown film head. Aroma has sweet vanilla, coffee, light sugary, mild oak. Lots of vanilla. Low carbonation, very fat and creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has again loads of vanilla, quite sweet, chocolate, light coffee, vinious and warming. Long, lingering, cocoa-milk and vanilla sweet finish. Cocio aplenty. Far too much.

Bottle poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours jet black with no head, just a very tiny bit of a tan ring around the glass. Looks like a thick motor oil consistency from pouring. Aromas of big vanilla, dark chocolate, coconut, light bourbon. Tasting notes of medium bourbon, big vanilla, dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel. Full body with a sticky oily mouthfeel. Fairly dry finish. Would like a bit more bourbon/barrel character but its still very enjoyable.

Tap at the Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Poured a deep mahogany with a round bubbly light tan head and little life. The aroma is rich roasted malt, sweet dark chocolate and boozy alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet, light bitter with a rich red berry fruit alcoholic bitter palate and a rich oily mouthfeel. Full bodied with flat carbonation. This really is a great beer. Not a classic but great all the same. Super rich, sweet but not sickly, well controlled alcohol which contributes to the beer, lots of chocolate ... but for me there could have been more. Really enjoyed this.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 07.02.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice dense dark brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is very rich and sweet, vanilla, espresso, cocoa nibs, dark chocolate, licorice, dark malts, sweet mild bourbon, oak, dark sugar, caramel. Taste is rich and balanced, dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, hops, dark sugar, dark malts, cocoa nibs, oak, licorice, caramel, sweet mild bourbon. Longlasting bitterness, thick syrupy mouthfeel. I say goddamn....goddamn what a rush!! Feel like popping another bottle right away!
[1 Feb-tripp till Mikkeller] Oj vad det här var RIKTIGT bra. Ett kraftpaket i både arom och smak, väldigt balanserad,

Man kan inte komma ifrån att det här va väldigt välsmakande, visserligen blir vaniljsmaken lite väl påträngande i längden och känslan av kvalmighet infinner sig i munnen. Men fram till känslan av kvalmighet är det en riktigt bra öl.

Keg at Mikkeller bar. It pours jet black with a small tan head. The nose is vanilla, marshmallow, coffee cake, chocolate, wood, bourbon and frosties. The taste is rich, gooey chocolate cake, fudge, marshmallow, vanilla, caramel, brownies, milky coffee, dark chocolate, coffee, light bitterness, wood and bourbon with a slick finish. Full body, soft carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich, indulgent, flavoursome and well balanced. Intense and delicious.

Tap. Pours pitch black with a medium sized, tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, chocolate, bourbon notes and vanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with alcohol. Full bodied, oily to creamy texture and soft carb. A great impy.
Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends ... It pours pitch black with almost no head ... Vanilla, roasted malt, brown sugar, caramel, coffee, dark fruits, bourbon, oak, chocolate.... Very nice!

Fra fad, Mikkeller & Friends. Knaldsort fed sort øl med et lysebrunt, lille men stabilt skumhovede. Intens sød vanillie-fedme i næsen. Og træ og bourbon. Smagen er ikke helt så vanille-sød som næsen. Masser af træ og bourbon i smagen. Kakao-noter. Ret heftig, men i fin balance. Meget kompakt, meget intens, men også lidt enstrenget. Og ikke nær så kompleks som sit rygte....og nej, jeg bliver aldrig stor fan af vanillie i øl...

Tap at mikkeller viktoriagade pitch dark smooth creamy dark brown head aroma is vanilla, bourbon, faint roasted malts, lots of vanilla also some cocoa.flavor is very complex, vanilla,bourbon,bitter malts,wood, salt, soft velvety texture, nice malts and hop bitterness below all the sweet stuff
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Tap @ Mikkeller, Victoriagade. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are ruch vanilla, bourbon, roast malt, chocolate and hops. Nice and sweet.

Bottle
Pours black, small to good brown head, pretty steady , unlike i expected .. 
Smell is intense vanilla . There is some - small - difference than what i remember the vanilla shake ( regular ) to be , but I wouldnt call it straight bourbon or oak . There is some more sweetness though . Gives the idea it will be a perfect blend, not overkill-bourbon Barrel aged , I like that !
low carbonation , thick mouthfeel 
Taste is way less intense vanilla than the regular . sweet, some hints of oak , maybe even a bit of bourbon . 
Than comes vanilla , underneath a spine of oats . 
Nice long , vanilla-bourbon finish . 
Nowhere is there to much bourbon . If I did not knew it was in there , I Probably wouldnt have guessed it . Its very very balanced !
The only downside ( and i never complained about this , I drank like 2200 beer before, some incredible whales included ) is the price . near to 20 euros for a small bottle , plus super expensive shipping ( Denmark charges a lot , its not mikkellers fault ! ) Is really, really much , counting ze got the regular vanilla shake here for like 6 euros each , I believe . Barrels cost a lot, but not THAT much ( or are they pappy barrels ? ) On the other hand, i got a free glass with it , plus incredible service, as always .. 

Very good beer , would buy way more if affortable

Draft. A pitch black beer with a brown head. The aroma has strong notes of vanilla and medium notes of roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of vanilla, roasted malt, bourbon, and soy sauce, leading to a dry sweet finish.

Fad: Kulsort olieret øl med et flot mokkabrunt skumhoved. Duften er meget vanilie og en del chokolade. Smagen er dejlig behagelig men lidt for meget af det hele næsten. Heldigvis er jeg jo sucker for vanilie og bourbon så det går.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody vanilla and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty sweetish chocolate and vanilla flavor. Has a roasted malty woody chocolate and vanilla finish.

03-JAN-2013, draft @Mikkeller & Friends. 
Pitch black with low brown head. 
Aroma is violent vanilla. Bourbon is also there but mostly a vanilla thing as well. 
Taste the same. Molasses, caramel, chocolate. 
Full body, soft carbonation. Long vanilla finish. This is extreme but it works.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Pitch black - nice brown head. Smooth malty. Wooden dryness. Toasted fresh wood. Vanilla. Light sweetness. Peppery. Ok bitterness. Full bodied. Lovely.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Pitch black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of vanilla beans, dark chocolate and vanilla with notes of bourbon.
Sweet and roasted flavour of vanilla, hops and dark chocolate with notes of vanilla beans.
Sweet finish.

From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to bæack with a small tan head. Aroma is slooth vanilla, bourbon and caramelish. Thick vanilla, liqourice. Toffeemalty nd caramelish. Bitter, smooth malty and caramelish finish. First sips where fantastic, then it becomes rather cloying towards the end.
